courses.title: Economic Analysis for Managers
courses.description: Studies the economic concepts that describe and explain the environment within which firms operate.

courses.title: Financial and Managerial Accounting
courses.description: Covers the basic concepts that underlie the use of accounting information.  Includes balance sheet, income statement, alternative costing systems.

courses.title: Financial Management in an Environment of Technological
courses.description: Change. Course focuses on financial concepts and how they are used to maximize the value of the firm and choose among alternative courses of action.

courses.title: Analytical Tools for Decision Support
courses.description: This course focuses on statistics and mathematical modeling of use to decision makers in technology environments with significant uncertainty.

courses.title: Processes of Technological Innovation
courses.description: This course addresses the processes involved in technological innovation, focusing on models, sources, flows, and the protection of innovation.

courses.title: Technology Strategies in Information Systems
courses.description: This course examines information systems and their impact in manufacturing and service operations.

courses.title: Managing People in a Technical Environment
courses.description: This course focuses on the management and leadership of people and human resource systems in modern organizations.

courses.title: Technology and Transformational Work Processes
courses.description: This course focuses on how work processes within organizations can be designed and managed to optimize output effectiveness.

courses.title: Strategy Execution
courses.description: This course introduces methods to adapt, evolve, or create change in the way organizations structure themselves to increase effectiveness in responding to competitive demands.

courses.title: Marketing in a Technical Environment
courses.description: This course focuses on the marketing function, its relationship to other functions within the firm, and its strategic significance to high-tech organizations.

courses.title: Seminar in the Management of Technology
courses.description: This seminar features senior executives from organizations that develop or use technology discussing current practices, policies, and issues.

courses.title: AI & Machine Learning for Business
courses.description: This course examines key emerging technologies, their development patterns, and the associated impact on industries, industrial competitiveness, and society.

courses.title: Strategy in Management of Technology
courses.description: This course examines and discusses how technology-based firms develop and implement business, functional, and technology strategies.

courses.title: Management of Technology Project III
courses.description: Participants complete their MOT project research, submit a written report, and present their results to their organization.

courses.title: Business and Leadership Skills
courses.description: Participant's technological, business, and leadership skills (communications, teamwork, conflict resolution, diversity) are enhanced.

courses.title: Creating Technology Ventures
courses.description: This course covers the issues associated with the earliest stages of new technology venture formation.

courses.title: International Issues in the Management of Technology
courses.description: Global business issues and strategies are explored through an international study tour.

courses.title: Building Technology Ventures
courses.description: The foucs of this course is on learning how to manage rapid growth in a technology venture.

courses.title: Venture Financing
courses.description: In this course students learn various methods for raising capital to fund new ventures.

courses.title: International Business and Finance
courses.description: The purpose of this course is to develop students' understanding of global business and finance.

courses.title: Management of Technology Project I
courses.description: Participant's develop and present a proposal for a technology-based team venture project.

courses.title: Management of Technology Project II
courses.description: Participant's execute their MOT venture project, including marketing and financial analyses.

courses.title: Management of Technology Project I
courses.description: First in a sequence of three courses where students execute their new venture project. During this segment, they focus on concept definition and team formation.

courses.title: Ethical Decision Making
courses.description: This course focuses on understanding and applying ethical decision making practices in business.

courses.title: Management of Technology Project II
courses.description: Second in a sequence of three courses where students execute their new venture project. During this segment, they focus on marketing and financial analyses of their new technology venture.
